alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Madison; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 8:28AM CST until January 11 at 5:16PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Huntsville AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Paint Rock River NEAR Woodville affecting Madison, Marshall and Jackson Counties. For the PAINT ROCK RIVER...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Paint Rock River near Woodville. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flood waters affect mostly bottomland along the river...including low lying farm and pasturelands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 2.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 16.5 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 01/17/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM CST.
